questions.question_text:
A company is implementing Dynamics 365 Finance.
You apply an update. After you test the update, you find that the delivery dates on some open sales orders occur in the past. You identify data conflicts based on the test results.
You need to ensure that the delivery date value is equal to or greater than the current data in future automated testing.
Which two options could you configure? Each answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Verified the given answer is correct. AD.

Selected Answer: AD
Task Recorder developer placeholder does not exists. A&D is correct answer

Selected Answer: A
Correct

Selected Answer: BD
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/lifecycle-services/using-task-guides-and-bpm-to-create-user-acceptance-tests
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamicsax-2012/appuser-itpro/set-up-delivery-date-control

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are planning to perform testing during an implementation of Dynamics 365 Finance.
You need to identify the appropriate tools to support the testing.
Which tools should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate tools to the correct requirements. Each tool may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
1.Create a user acceptance test library: Business process modeler and Task Recorder
2.Use a business process recording to perform acceptance tests: Regression suite automation tool
3. Use shared package to verify import process: Data Risk Valuation

1: BPM
2: RSAT - This tool is for automatization of regression testing using task recordings and modifications to allow them to be replayed automatically on-demand. 
3: Not quite sure, but after a brief discussion with ChatGPT, the choice of RSAT again could fit. ChatGPT says: 'The Regression suite automation tool helps you automate testing of business processes and scenarios. It can be used to create test cases that can be run repeatedly to ensure that the system is working as expected.

When you use a shared package to verify import processes, you can use the Regression suite automation tool to test the import process. You can create a test case that includes the import process and then run it repeatedly to ensure that the import process is working as expected.'

1.BPM
2. task recorder
3. RSAT
We can register business processes with Task recorder and run with RSAT.

1. Asset library type: Project level
2. Asset type: GER configuration
3. Asset scope: Organization
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/lifecycle-services/asset-library

comments.content: 1: should be shared, because of 3rd party involvement

discussion.content:
Library type:
- Shared asset library is used by Microsoft and Partners to share assets across multiple tenants.
Project-level Asset library is used to share assets across environments within a project in Lifecycle Services.
Asst type:
- Software deployable package represents all the packages that are used to update an environment with the latest set of updates.
- Data package stores assets that are used for configuration and data management.
- GER Configuration stores all localization and translation assets that are applied to the client.
- Retail SDK stores all the latest scripts for the Retail software development kit (SDK).
- Database backups are used for importing and exporting of databases.
Asset scope:
- Me scope is visible only to the person who uploaded the asset.
- Project scope is for assets related to the project.
- Organization scope shares the assets with multiple users within a tenant.
- Global scope is authored by MS only.

Asset scopes
Every asset that the Asset library supports has multiple scopes. Here are some of the supported asset scopes:

Me – When an asset is uploaded, it's set to the Me scope. An asset that has the Me scope is visible only to the person who uploaded the asset.
Project – When an asset is imported from the Global scope to another project, it's set to the Project scope.
Organization – When an asset must be shared with multiple users within a tenant, the tenant admin can promote the asset to the Organization scope.
Global – Only Microsoft can upload assets to the Global scope. These assets are assets that Microsoft wants to be made publicly available to all Lifecycle Services projects and users.

comments.content: Defintion of Organization Project scope: When an asset must be shared with multiple users within a tenant, the tenant admin can promote the asset to the Organization scope. -> In the case nothing is mentioned about multiple users, so we keep the default "Project"

discussion.content: Why is Project Scope "Project" and not "Organization"?

discussion.content: Correct answers
